Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Champagne \Cham*pagne"\, n. [F. See {Champaign}.] A light wine, of several kinds, originally made in the province of Champagne, in France. [1913 Webster]
Note: Champagne properly includes several kinds not only of sparkling but of still wines; but in America the term is usually restricted to wines which effervesce. [1913 Webster]
champagne n 1: a white sparkling wine either produced in Champagne or resembling that produced there [syn: {bubbly}] 2: a region of northeastern France [syn: {Champagne-Ardenne}]
